actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on December 19, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Diaz-Balart moved that the House do now adjourn.
Mr. Diaz-Balart asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on December 19. Agreed to without objection.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: Commission on the Future of the Navy
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 1092(b)(2) of the James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023(Public Law 117-263), the Democratic Leader and Majority Leader of the Senate appointed Co-Chair Honorable Filemon Vela, Houston, Texas.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. S. Con. Res. 44 — "Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make a correction in the enrollment of the bill H.R. 5009."
Mr. Rogers (AL) asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 18 2024, at 3:15 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 4654, S. 5005, S. 5130, S. 5398, S. 5575, Senate agreed to S. Con. Res. 44, Senate agreed to the House Amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 5009, and passed H.R. 663.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 18, 2024, at 3:15 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 1097, S. 1144, S. 1277, S. 1299, S. 3022, S. 3373, S. 3502, S. 3543, S. 4181, and S. 4576.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 18, 2024, at 3:15 p.m.: That the Senate passed H.R. 1607, H.R. 1727, H.R. 2468, H.R. 3324, H.R. 4094, H.R. 4385, H.R. 5770, H.R. 6826, H.R. 6843, H.R. 7332, and H.R. 9566.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3959.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Green (TN) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3959 — "To require the Transportation Security Administration to streamline the enrollment processes for individuals applying for a Transportation Security Administration security threat assessment for certain programs, including the Transportation Worker Identification Credential and Hazardous Materials Endorsement Threat Assessment programs of the Administration, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Green (TN) objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8662.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Green (TN) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8662 — "To reduce commuting burdens on Transportation Security Administration employees, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8664.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Green (TN) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8664 — "To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to direct the Under Secretary for Intelligence and Analysis of the Department of Homeland Security to conduct an annual audit of the information systems and bulk data of the Office of Intelligence and Analysis of the Department, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Green (TN) objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9748.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Green (TN) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9748 — "To require the Under Secretary of the Science and Technology Directorate of the Department of Homeland Security to develop a Department-wide policy and process to safeguard research and development from unauthorized access to or disclosure of sensitive information in research and development acquisitions, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

Mr. Strong asked unanimous consent that he may hereafter be considered as the first sponsor of H.R. 4864, a bill originally introduced by Representative Gaetz, for the purpose of adding cosponsors and requesting reprintings pursuant to clause 7 of rule XII. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 381
actions-list.actionItem: 20 (Roll no. 515).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 759 — "To authorize the National Detector Dog Training Center, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 404
actions-list.actionItem: 1 (Roll no. 514).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 369
actions-list.actionItem: 37 (Roll no. 513).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 3857 — "To take certain land in the State of California into trust for the benefit of the Jamul Indian Village of California, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 373
actions-list.actionItem: 33 (Roll no. 512).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 1351 — "To study and prevent child abuse in youth residential programs, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 759.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Thompson (PA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 759 — "To authorize the National Detector Dog Training Center, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments to H.R. 8663.
Mr. Green (TN) moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments.
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Budzinski to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Dale W. Strong to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
